cache.size.label: Cache size:
cache.size.description: Number of URLs fetched and parsed before saving results (0=infinite).

newest.only.description: Parse only the newest content for each URL.

result.table.label: Result table:
result.table.description: Table name to save parsed fields to.

skip.label: Skip URLs:
skip.description: Boolean RegEx queries on URLs that will not be parsed.

sleep.idle.description: Time (in ms) to wait before checking for new URLs when all URLs have been parsed.

sleep.mysql.description: Time (in s) to wait before last try to re-connect to mySQL server.

timeout.target.lock.description: Time-out (in s) of target table locks.

datetime.formats.label: Date/time formats:
datetime.formats.description:
The date and time formats to be parsed (default: %F %T)
(see 'to_stream formatting' in Howard E. Hinnant's C++ date.h library documentation for details).

datetime.locales.label: Date/time locales:
datetime.locales.description:
Locales used for parsing the date and time
(e.g. 'en_US.UTF8', see C++ 'std::locale' documentary for details).

datetime.queries.label: Date/time queries:
datetime.queries.description: Queries used for parsing the date and time. The first query that returns a non-empty result will be used.

datetime.sources.label: Date/time sources:
datetime.sources.description: Where to parse the date and time from.

field.delimiters.description: Delimiters for multiple results when not saved as JSON. Only first character or \n (default), \t, \\ will be used.

field.ignore.empty.description: Ignore empty values when parsing multiple elements (default behavior).

field.json.label: Field results as JSON:
field.json.description: Save parsed data as JSON array.

field.names.label: Field names:
field.names.description: The names of the custom fields to parse.

field.queries.label: Field queries:
field.queries.description: The queries used to parse the custom fields.

field.sources.label: Field sources:
field.sources.description: Where to parse the custom fields from.

field.tidy.texts.label: Field results as tidied texts:
field.tidy.texts.description: Remove line breaks and unnecessary spaces.

field.warnings.empty.description: Log warning when field is empty.

id.queries.label: ID queries:
id.queries.description: Queries to parse the ID. The first query that returns a non-empty result will be used. Pages with duplicate or empty IDs will not be parsed.

id.sources.label: ID sources:
id.sources.description: Where to parse the ID from.
